physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Generalized absence of subcutaneous fat and mottled skin hyperpigmentation around the neck, axillae, and groin. Mild scoliosis and joint contractures, especially at the knees. Hypertriglyceridemia, mild diabetes mellitus, hypertension, and proteinuria. An echocardiogram showed normal cardiac function with mild mitral and aortic regurgitation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 10, she started metreleptin therapy resulting in marked lowering of fasting serum triglycerides from 1026 mg/dL to 118 mg/dL after 4 months.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Fasting serum triglycerides were 1287 mg/dL and hemoglobin A1c was 8.3%.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Remarkable loss of adiposity, especially from the face and the extremities. Atrophic skin with mottled hyperpigmentation, mild acanthosis nigricans, and joint contractures of the phalangeal joints, wrists, and ankles.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 14, he developed worsening of diabetes (hemoglobin A1c, 9.2%) and extreme hypertriglyceridemia (serum triglycerides, 6640 mg/dL) with eruptive xanthomas.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Failure to thrive despite voracious appetite and generalized absence of subcutaneous fat. Contractures of the phalangeal joints, mild scoliosis, and hepatomegaly.
Generalized loss of fat at age 5 and joint contractures of ankles, knees, and hips.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Received metreleptin therapy for only 10 months at age 15 years, which improved diabetes and hypertriglyceridemia.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Initially presented with acanthosis nigricans at the age of 6 months.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Marked improvement in diabetes and hyperlipidemia with metreleptin therapy since age 8.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mottled skin with patchy hyperpigmentation and hypopigmentation. Severe diabetes with insulin resistance.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 32 years, the left ventricular ejection fraction declined to 15%, and she received cardiac transplantation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mottled skin pigmentation on abdomen which resolved around age 13, showing muscular arms and legs. Fatty liver noted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Had myocardial infarction and required coronary stents at age 38.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Gradual generalized loss of subcutaneous fat between ages 10 and 12 years. Mild thoracic scoliosis and kyphosis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 13 years, echocardiogram revealed possible noncompaction cardiomyopathy and improved hemoglobin A1c from 10.4% to 5.7% with metreleptin therapy.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Developed acute pancreatitis, generalized loss of subcutaneous fat, and had a small secundum atrial septal defect.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Metreleptin treatment started at age 9 years, had menarche at age 10.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Had mottled skin on torso and extremities, generalized loss of fat, and lower extremities appeared hypertrophic.
Had mottled skin pigmentation, hepatomegaly, and fat loss with acanthosis nigricans.
